headline: Nomura raises Nifty target to 26,140 for March 2026, highlights 17 high-conviction stock picks
intro: Nomura has raised its Nifty 50 target to 26,140 for March 2026, citing India's macroeconomic stability and potential. The upgrade reflects a 6% upside and focuses on domestic demand-driven sectors, supported by reforms and liquidity, despite global market uncertainties.
imagecaption: Nomura raises Nifty target to 26,140 for March 2026, highlights 17 high-conviction stock picks

headline: Recommended stocks to buy today: Top stock picks by market experts for 28 May
intro: Recommended shares today: Discover the top stock picks by market experts Raja Venkatraman, MarketSmith India, and Trade Brains for Wednesday, 28 May.
imagecaption: Recommended stocks to buy today: Market experts  recommend these stocks for 28 May.  (Image: Pexel):

headline: Dividend Stocks: ITC, Bajaj Finance, Infosys, among others to trade ex-dividend next week; Full list
intro: Dividend Stocks: Companies including Angel One, Bajaj Finance, ITC, Tata Consumer Products, L&T Finance, Infosys and Colgate Palmolive (India) are other firms which will trade ex-dividend in the upcoming week starting Monday, 26 May 2025.
imagecaption: Dividend Stocks: Some companies are trading ex-dividend next week, while some will trade ex-bonus issue this upcoming week.

headline: FMCG firms have been hunting for deals. Their appetite is only growing bigger
intro: Dabur India, Marico and Emami will continue to scout for M&As that help them enter new categories such as premium personal care and wellness, build a digital-first portfolio, and expand reach in the traditional market
imagecaption: Large fast-moving consumer goods makers built mass-market portfolios of soaps, salt, biscuits, shampoos and more for a broader reach.

headline: Q4 earnings watch: Consumption giants drive revenue but lag in profits
intro: In the latest edition of Q4FY25 earnings series, Mint explores the financial health of the consumption-focused market leaders compared to the rest of India Inc.
imagecaption: Data shows that 13 consumption-driven companies from the Nifty India Consumption Index, which includes firms deriving over half their revenue from domestic demand, saw their aggregate revenue grow 11.9% year-on-year. (Image: Pixabay)

headline: Stocks to buy for long term: Axis Bank to M&M ? ICICI Securities expert picks five shares to buy for up to 43% gain
intro: Stocks to buy for the long term: Despite market volatility, the Nifty 50 rose 3.5% in April. Pankaj Pandey from ICICI Securities highlights five stocks, including Axis Bank, Tata Consumer Products and Mahindra & Mahindra, with expected upsides ranging from 14% to 43%.
imagecaption: Stocks to buy for the long term: Pankaj Pandey, Head of Research at ICICI Securities, is positive about five stocks, including Axis Bank and Mahindra and Mahindra.

headline: Britannia, Tata Consumer to HUL: 14 Nifty FMCG stocks rally up to 30% from March lows. What's behind the surge?
intro: FMCG stocks have rallied in April, driven by positive investor sentiment and government measures boosting consumption. Analysts anticipate a strong recovery in earnings growth in FY26, with valuations now reasonable after previous selling pressure in the sector.
imagecaption: 14 Nifty FMCG stocks rally up to 30% from March lows: Tata Consumer, GCPL top gainers

headline: Tata Consumer Products share price falls over 4% after Q4 results. Should you buy or sell?
intro: Tata Consumer Products reported a 59% year-on-year (YoY) growth in its Q4FY35 consolidated net profit to  ?345 crore from  ?216.63 crore in the same period last year.
imagecaption: Tata Consumer Products' revenue from operations increased 17% to  ?4,608 crore in the quarter ended March 2025 from  ?3,927 crore in the March 2024 quarter.

headline: Tata Consumer eyes US coffee advantage amid proposed tariffs
intro: The company anticipates a relatively even playing field from a competitive standpoint as the US does not produce coffee or tea.
imagecaption: Sunil D?Souza, MD and CEO, Tata Consumer Products Ltd.

headline: Tata Consumer Q4 Results: Tata group company posts 59% YoY jump in profit to  ?345 crore, declares dividend
intro: Tata Consumer Q4 Results: Tata group company posted a 59% YoY surge in profit to  ?345 crore while revenue rose 17% in the March 2025 quarter. The company also announced a dividend of  ?8.25 per share.
imagecaption: Tata Consumer Q4 Results: Tata group company posts 59% YoY jump in profit to  ?345 crore, declares dividend
